VI.iii.1.C.2.g
.
Cases in Which the Surviving Spouse’s Award Has Been Apportioned for a Child
If the surviving spouse’s award was already apportioned for a child(ren) prior to incarceration, do not change payments to or for the child(ren).  If current income and net worth information is not of record, ask the child(ren)’s custodian or the child(ren), if of the age of majority, to provide it within 30 days
.
Exception
:  Do
not
develop for income and net worth information from a child who is receiving Section 306 Pension unless it appears current-law pension would be to the child’s advantage.
Reference
:  For information on adjusting apportionment awards, see
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart iii, 1.B
.
